revised_title: Effects of Faradic Excitation on Respiration and Brain Function in Monkeys, Dogs, Cats, and Rabbits
tldr: This study investigates the effects of Faradic excitation of the cerebrum on respiration in monkeys, dogs, cats, and rabbits. The researchers found four main effects on respiration: diminished action, slowing and arrest of the respiratory rhythm, acceleration, and hyperinspiratory clonus. They also discovered that hyperinspiratory tonus is an important general phenomenon. The study provides valuable insights into the relationship between brain function and respiration.
